meanings.definition: A half of a sphere, especially the earth.
meanings.sent1: The globe is divided into two hemispheres.
meanings.sent2: I learned about the northern and southern hemispheres in geography class.
meanings.sent3: The cake was cut into hemispheres, making it look like two mini planets.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like two separate hemispheres, each with its own thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The image of the earth's hemispheres stayed vividly in my mind after studying them.

meanings.sent1: The left and right hemispheres of the brain have different functions.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how the hemispheres of the brain work together.
meanings.sent3: His brain felt like two hemispheres constantly arguing with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed from the right hemisphere of her brain like a river.
meanings.sent5: The concept of brain hemispheres became clearer after the science lesson.

meanings.definition: A half of the celestial sphere.
meanings.sent1: Stargazers observe the northern and southern hemispheres of the sky.
meanings.sent2: The hemispheres of the night sky were filled with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent3: The telescope focused on the celestial hemispheres, revealing a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent4: The moon seemed to divide the sky into two hemispheres of light and dark.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the celestial hemispheres left me in awe of the universe.
